Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.impl.schema.reader

Class SimpleIndexReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.api.index.AbstractIndexReader
      • org.neo4j.kernel.api.impl.schema.reader.SimpleIndexReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Resource, IndexReader
    public class SimpleIndexReader
extends AbstractIndexReader
    Schema index reader that is able to read/sample a single partition of a partitioned Lucene index.
    See Also:
    PartitionedIndexReader

      • query

        public void query​(QueryContext context,
                  IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient client,
                  IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
                  IndexQuery... predicates)
           throws IndexNotApplicableKernelException
        Description copied from interface: IndexReader
        Queries the index for the given IndexQuery predicates.
        client - the client which will control the progression though query results.
        constraints - constraints upon the query result, like ordering and whether the index should fetch property values alongside the entity ids.
        predicates - the query so serve.
        Throws:
        IndexNotApplicableKernelException

      • search

        private DocValuesCollector search​(org.apache.lucene.search.Query query)

                                              throws IndexNotApplicableKernelException
        Throws:
        IndexNotApplicableKernelException

      • hasFullValuePrecision

        public boolean hasFullValuePrecision​(IndexQuery... predicates)
        Parameters:
        predicates - query to determine whether index has full value precision for.
        Returns:
        whether or not this reader will only return 100% matching results from IndexReader.query(QueryContext, IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient, IndexQueryConstraints, IndexQuery...). If false is returned this means that the caller of IndexReader.query(QueryContext, IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient, IndexQueryConstraints, IndexQuery...) will have to do additional filtering, double-checking of actual property values, externally.

      • assertNotComposite

        private void assertNotComposite​(IndexQuery[] predicates)

      • countIndexedNodes

        public long countIndexedNodes​(long nodeId,
                              PageCursorTracer cursorTracer,
                              int[] propertyKeyIds,
                              Value... propertyValues)
        Parameters:
        nodeId - node id to match.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        propertyKeyIds - the property key ids that correspond to each of the property values.
        propertyValues - property values to match.
        Returns:
        number of index entries for the given nodeId and propertyValues.

        public void close()
